t: “Hear*pn this word, you cows of Bashan, who*ld are on the mountain of Samaria, who*ln oppress the poor, who crush the needy, who*ld say to your husbands, ‘Bring, that we may drink!’
The*ln Lord God*s has sworn by his holiness that,*ld behold, the days are coming upon you, when*ln they shall take you away with hooks, even*ld the last of you with fishhooks.
And*ln you shall go out through the breaches, each*ld one straight ahead; and*ld you shall be cast out into Harmon,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“Come*pn to Bethel, and transgress; to*ld Gilgal, and multiply transgression; bring*ln your sacrifices every morning, your*ld tithes every three days;
offer*ln a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened, and*ld proclaim freewill offerings, publish them; for*ld so you love to do, O people of Israel!” declares*l the Lord God.*s
Israel Has Not Returned to the Lord
“I*pn gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and*ld lack of bread in all your places, yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s

“I*pn also withheld the rain from you when*ld there were yet three months to the harvest; I*ln would send rain on one city, and*ld send no rain on another city; one*ln field would have rain, and*ld the field on which it did not rain would wither;
so*ln two or three cities would wander to another city to*ld drink water, and would not be satisfied; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“I*pn struck you with blight and mildew; your*ld many gardens and your vineyards, your*ld fig trees and your olive trees the locust devoured; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s

“I*pn sent among you a pestilence after the manner of Egypt; I*ld killed your young men with the sword, and*ln carried away your horses, and*ld I made the stench of your camp go up into your nostrils; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“I*pn overthrew some of you, as*ld when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and*ld you were as a brand plucked out of the burning; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“Therefore*pn thus I will do to you, O Israel; because*ld I will do this to you, prepare*ld to meet your God, O Israel!”

For*pn behold, he who forms the mountains and creates the wind, and*ld declares to man what is his thought, who*ln makes the morning darkness, and*ld treads on the heights of the earth— the*ld Lord,*s the God of hosts, is his name!
